sentences.en: ...a bronze bust of Thomas Jefferson.
sentences.cn: …一座托马斯·杰斐逊的半身铜像。

sentences.en: a 36-inch bust
sentences.cn: 36英寸的胸围

sentences.en: At the very top of the steps was a bust of Shakespeare on a pedestal.
sentences.cn: 就在台阶顶端的基座上有一尊莎士比亚胸像.

sentences.en: Do you have this dress in a bigger bust size?
sentences.cn: 有胸围比这件大些的衣服 吗 ?

sentences.en: Good posture also helps your bust look bigger.
sentences.cn: 优美的姿势也能让你的胸部看起来更丰满。

sentences.en: I bust my camera.
sentences.cn: 我把照相机摔坏了。

sentences.en: I bust my watch this morning.
sentences.cn: 今天早上我把手表摔坏了。

sentences.en: I dropped my camera on the pavement and bust it.
sentences.cn: 我把照相机掉在人行道上摔坏了.

sentences.en: I worked up a lump of clay into a bust of my mother.
sentences.cn: 我把一块粘土制作成我母亲的半身像。

sentences.en: I'm going to bust in on that damned harbor master.
sentences.cn: 我要去找那该死的港务长算账.

sentences.en: She had had this bust-up with her family.
sentences.cn: 她跟家人大吵过一场。

sentences.en: She has a beautiful bust.
sentences.cn: 她的胸部很美.

sentences.en: She made a plaster cast of a bust of Lincoln.
sentences.cn: 她用石膏塑造了一座林肯半身像.

sentences.en: Sue and Tony had a bust-up and aren't speaking to each other.
sentences.cn: 休和托尼大吵了一架，现在谁也不理谁。

sentences.en: The couple bust up after an argument.
sentences.cn: 那对夫妻经过一场争吵就离异了.

sentences.en: The trip to Spain will probably bust our budget.
sentences.cn: 这次西班牙之行可能会超出我们的预算。

sentences.en: The workers are casting a stainless steel bust.
sentences.cn: 工人们正在铸造一座不锈钢的胸像.

sentences.en: They will have to bust the door to get him out.
sentences.cn: 他们将不得不撞破门把他弄出来。

sentences.en: Tony busted the door down.
sentences.cn: 托尼把门砸烂了。

sentences.en: We must avoid the damaging boom-bust cycles which characterised the 1980s.
sentences.cn: 我们必须避免出现20世纪80年代那样具有破坏性的繁荣萧条交替循环的局面。

words.tran_cn: 被降级的；破产了的；失败了的
起破坏，制止作用的人或物；庞然大物；非凡的人或物；小鬼，小家伙；茁壮的孩子
爆裂；破产；开除；崩溃（bust的过去分词形式）

trans.tran_cn: 半身像，（女人的）胸部，（警方）突击搜捕，蹩脚的东西
trans.tran_en: a model of someone’s head, shoulders, and upper chest, usually made of stone or metal

trans.tran_cn: 打碎，破坏，逮捕，（警察）搜查
trans.tran_en: to use too much money, so that a business etc must stop operating
to use too much money, so that a business etc must stop operating
